required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Cath Lab Staff Radiation Exposure
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiac Cath Lab Staff Radiation Exposure During Chronic Total Occlusion PCI: CorPath GRX vs. Manual

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this randomized safety and observational study is to demonstrate CorPath GRX chronic total occlusion PCI is safe, and that Cardiac Catheterization Laboratory staff have no additional exposure to radiation when compared to conventional manual chronic total occlusion PCI procedures without added procedure time.

detailed_description.textblock: This is prospective, dual-arm, randomized, multi-center, observational study comparing patient outcomes and staff radiation exposure in chronic total occlusion PCI procedures through 48 hours post procedure or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first.

primary_outcome.description: Defined as successful CTO PCI revascularization with achievement of <30% residual diameter stenosis (visual estimate) within the treated segment and restoration of antegrade TIMI grade 3 flow, without in-hospital major adverse events (MAE).
Number of MAE events that occurs within 48 hours of the CTO PCI procedure or hospital discharge, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative dose the physician receives as recorded from electronic pocket dosimeter during procedure.
Cumulative dose the staff receives as recorded from electronic pocket dosemeter during procedure.
DAP (dose-area-product) and cumulative dose/air kerma as recorded during the procedure
Total fluoroscopy (min.) utilized during the procedure as recorded by an Imaging System.

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Total Occlusion of Coronary Artery

arm_group.description: The procedure will be randomized in a 1:1 fashion to either CorPath GRX robotic-assisted Chronic Total Occlusion PCI or conventional manual Chronic Total Occlusion PCI.
The procedure will be randomized in a 1:1 fashion to either CorPath GRX robotic-assisted Chronic Total Occlusion PCI or conventional manual Chronic Total Occlusion PCI.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects >18 years of age with symptoms suggestive of ischemic heart disease, with TIMI grade 0 flow and a lesion that is thought to be present for more than 3 months.

facility.name: St. Luke's Hospital of Kansas City

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available 12 months after study completion.
